alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 1:37PM MST until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Montana... Jefferson River near Three Forks affecting Broadwater and Gallatin Counties. Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. For the Jefferson River...including DCP-Twin Bridges, Three Forks... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Gallatin River...including DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway, Logan... elevated river levels are forecast. ...The Flood Advisory remains in effect... The Flood Advisory continues for the Jefferson River near Three Forks. * Until further notice. * At 1:00 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 6.6 feet. * Action stage is 7.0 feet. * Flood stage is 8.0 feet. * Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 7.5 feet late this afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. * At 7.5 feet, agricultural land floods near Three Forks. At 8.0 feet, farm buildings flood around Three Forks. At 8.5 feet, adjacent county roads and bridges may have water flowing over them. Several homes in low-lying areas may flood. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM MST.
